definition: (literary) to remonstrate with one's superior tactfully

sentences.english: It is an important feature of poetic viewpoints of the Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 重视诗歌的讽谏功能，是汉代诗学的重要特点。

sentences.english: There are also some expostulation poems among works written by literati of Han dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 汉代的文人诗歌创作，也有一些讽谏的作品。

sentences.english: Flattering words are welcomed while advice or criticism will offend those rich and powerful people.
sentences.chinese: 好话总是令人欢喜，讽谏总会得罪权贵。

sentences.english: Chapter 4 sorts out the expostulation consciousness in poems and Fu written in Han dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 第四章寻绎汉代诗赋创作中所表现出来的讽谏意识。

definition: variant of 諷喻|讽喻[feng3 yu4]
to remonstrate/to warn earnestly (esp. classical written Chinese)/to exhort
to borrow the past as a model for the present
falsification in writing/misrepresentation in written history/deliberate digression
Jia Yi (200-168 BC), Chinese poet and statesman of the Western Han Dynasty
to use the past to disparage the present (idiom)
